Package main.java.matrices

Interface Matrix

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CMatrix, DMatrix, GMatrix
    public interface Matrix
    Interface is the base for all matrix classes and provides access to useful static method functionality.
    Author:
    Joshua McDonagh

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void clear()
      Clears the contents of the matrix.
      void clear​(int height, int width)
      Clears the contents of the matrix and replaces it with an empty matrix of a set height and width.

      Generates and returns a duplicated version of the matrix.

        Constructs an identity matrix of a given size.
        Parameters:

      • sort

        static <T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>> CMatrix<T> sort​(int index,
                                                           CMatrix<T> matrix,
                                                           boolean ascending)
        Sorts the contents of a comparable matrix by a given column index in either an ascending or descending way.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Type of data that the given matrix contains
        Parameters:
        index - Column index to base the sort process on
        matrix - Comparable matrix to sort
        ascending - Boolean value which is true if the matrix is to be sorted in an ascending way, otherwise false
        Returns:
        The sorted comparable matrix

      • clear

        void clear​(int height,
           int width)
        Clears the contents of the matrix and replaces it with an empty matrix of a set height and width.
        Parameters:
        height - Integer value to set the matrix height to
        width - Integer value to set the matrix width to

      • get

        java.lang.Object get​(int row,
                     int column)
        Gets a specific value from the matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - Row index of the value
        column - Column index of the value
        Returns:
        The specific value at the row and column indexes of the matrix

      • getRows

        Matrix getRows​(int start,
               int end)
        Method returns a set of rows from the matrix as a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        start - The row index of the first row of the matrix to be extracted (inclusive)
        end - The row index of the last row of the matrix to be extracted (exclusive)
        Returns:
        A matrix consisting of the selected rows

      • getRows

        Matrix getRows​(int row)
        Method returns a row from the matrix as a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        row - The row index of the row of the matrix to be extracted
        Returns:
        A matrix consisting of the selected row

      • getColumns

        Matrix getColumns​(int start,
                  int end)
        Method returns a set of columns from the matrix as a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        start - The column index of the first column of the matrix to be extracted (inclusive)
        end - The column index of the last column of the matrix to be extracted (exclusive)
        Returns:
        A matrix consisting of the selected columns

      • getColumns

        Matrix getColumns​(int column)
        Method returns a column from the matrix as a new matrix.
        Parameters:
        column - The column index of the column of the matrix to be extracted
        Returns:
        A matrix consisting of the selected column

      • deleteRows

        void deleteRows​(int start,
                int end)
        Deletes and removes a defined range of rows from the matrix.
        Parameters:
        start - The row index of the first row of the matrix to be deleted (inclusive)
        end - The row index of the last row of the matrix to be deleted (exclusive)

      • deleteColumns

        void deleteColumns​(int start,
                   int end)
        Deletes and removes a defined range of columns from the matrix.
        Parameters:
        start - The column index of the first column of the matrix to be deleted (inclusive)
        end - The column index of the last column of the matrix to be deleted (exclusive)

      • width

        int width()
        Gets the width of the matrix (i.e. the number of columns).
        Returns:
        The width of the matrix as an integer

      • height

        int height()
        Gets the height of the matrix (i.e. the number of rows).
        Returns:
        The height of the matrix as an integer

      • isEmpty

        boolean isEmpty()
        Returns whether the matrix is empty or not.
        Returns:
        Boolean value which is true if the matrix is empty, otherwise false

      • isSquare

        boolean isSquare()
        Returns whether the matrix is square (the height and width are equal) or not.
        Returns:
        Boolean value which is true if the matrix is square, otherwise false

      • transpose

        Matrix transpose()
        Method returns a transpose of the matrix.
        Returns:
        A transposed version of the matrix

      • toArray

        java.lang.Object[][] toArray()
        Converts the matrix into a 2D array.
        Returns:
        A 2D array containing the matrix's values

      • map

        void map​(MapFunction mapFunction)
        Maps a function across all values of the matrix.
        Parameters:
        mapFunction - A functional interface which contains the functional method to apply to the matrix values

      • clone

        Matrix clone()
        Generates and returns a duplicated version of the matrix.
        Returns:
        A matrix consisting of the same values

      • show

        void show()
        Displays the matrix on the console in a formatted way.

      • iterator

        java.util.Iterator<?> iterator()
        Generates a new matrix iterator.
        Returns:
        An iterator for the matrix
